ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin majoritas ('superiority, status of being greater'), derived from Latin major ('greater'), comparative of magnus ('great').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The greater number or part; a number or quantity that is more than half of a total.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 多数；大多数；超过半数的数量或部分。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The majority of the committee members approved the budget proposal.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 委员会的大多数成员批准了该预算提案。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The difference between the number of votes or seats received by the winning side and the total number received by the losing side(s) or the next largest group.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 多数票；优势票数；多数席位（获胜方比失败方多出的票数或席位数）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The candidate won by a large majority of over 20,000 votes.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该候选人以超过20,000张选票的巨大优势获胜。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The age at which a person is legally deemed to be an adult, capable of managing their own affairs (usually 18 or 21).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 法定成年年龄；成年状态。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He will not gain control of the trust fund until he reaches his majority.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他要到法定成年年龄才能获得信托基金的控制权。

REGISTER: Common in general, political, and formal/legal discourse.
